header.title: AI for Precision Cardiometabolic Health Lab supported by AIM-AHEAD Program for AI Readiness (PAIR)

heroArea.title: AI for Precision Cardiometabolic Health Lab
heroArea.subTitle: supported by AIM-AHEAD Program for AI Readiness (PAIR)

left.text: The AI for Precision Cardiometabolic Health Laboratory
left.textSubsidiary: The AI for Precision Cardiometabolic Health Laboratory, supported by AIM-AHEAD Program for AI Readiness (PAIR), is at the forefront of integrating artificial intelligence into health research.  Our lab focuses on AI-driven solutions that improve accuracy of cardiometabolic risk criteria, enhance cardiometabolic health literacy, and that Increase health equity for all populations.  Through PAIR we leverage cutting edge AI technologies and collaborate with industry leaders to prepare the next generation of researchers for the evolving demands of Healthcare innovation

one.text-1-3: Our multidisciplinary faculty team is dedicated to advancing AI-driven research to reduce cardiometabolic disease-related disparities.  We offer exceptional resources to educate and train scientists and health professionals, empowering them to shape the future AI workforce.

two.text-2-3: We collaborate with national and local colleges, Universities, research labs and healthcare institutions.

three.text-3-3: We are excited to partner with AIM-AHEAD to reduce Cardiometabolic health disparities using AI/ML.

regionThree.titleSecondary: Learn more about PAIR and how you can get involved

regionFour.titleSecondary: Get in Touch, Let’s Make an Impact Together

EventList.col3: Dr. [PI Name] was awarded the Outstanding Faculty Award, This award is in recognition of her outstanding contributions to XXXXXXX.

EventList.col1: AIM-AHEAD Program for Artificial Intelligence Readiness (PAIR) Cohort 2 Experts & Coaches CFA
EventList.col3: The AIM-AHEAD Program for Artificial Intelligence Readiness (PAIR) is recruiting Experts and Grant Writing Coaches for the second cohort of the AIM-AHEAD PAIR Program. This program will engage several teams of researchers from institutions facing challenges in developing research capacities to build an AI for Health Disparities Lab within their organization.

FacultyList.name: FirstName1 LastName1, Ph.D.
FacultyList.title: Professor
FacultyList.introduction: Dr. FirstName1 LastName1, Ph.D., is a Professor renowned for their pioneering research in computational biology. Their work leverages big data analytics to decode complex biological systems, contributing to advancements in genetic engineering and personalized medicine. Dr. LastName1’s laboratory is at the forefront of developing algorithms that predict molecular behavior, which are crucial for new drug development. As a respected leader in the field, Dr. LastName1 has published numerous influential papers and serves as a mentor to aspiring scientists in this rapidly evolving discipline.

FacultyList.name: FirstName2 LastName2, Ph.D., MPH
FacultyList.title: Associate Professor
FacultyList.introduction: Dr. FirstName2 LastName2, Ph.D., MPH, is an Associate Professor with a dual focus on public health and epidemiology. Dr. LastName2’s research integrates advanced statistical methodologies with public health practices to analyze and address the spread and control of infectious diseases. Their work has significantly contributed to improving disease surveillance and intervention strategies. Dr. LastName2 is also an active member of several professional health organizations and frequently collaborates on interdisciplinary projects that aim to enhance community health outcomes.

FacultyList.name: FirstName3 LastName3, M.D., Ph.D.
FacultyList.title: Assistant Professor
FacultyList.introduction: Dr. FirstName3 LastName3 is an Assistant Professor specializing in Artificial Intelligence and Healthcare. With a Ph.D. in Computer Science, Dr. LastName3’s research aims to enhance medical diagnostics and treatment through advanced AI algorithms. They have published extensively in this field and teach related courses focusing on AI applications and data ethics in healthcare.

publications.content:
Enhancing Diagnostic Accuracy through Machine Learning: A Case Study in Predictive Oncology


Dr. FirstName LastName, Dr. FirstName2 LastName2, Dr. FirstName3 LastName3


Abstract: This study explores the application of machine learning algorithms in the field of oncology, focusing on the development of predictive models that improve the accuracy of cancer diagnostics. Utilizing a dataset comprising patient genetic profiles and historical treatment outcomes, we demonstrate how our model outperforms traditional diagnostic approaches by incorporating real-time data and adaptive learning techniques.


Published in: Journal of AI in Healthcare, Volume 15, Issue 4, August 2025


Keywords: Machine Learning, Oncology, Predictive Models, Diagnostic Accuracy


DOI: 12.3456/jaihc.2025.78910
